thread.title: Kenya: Ge Launches Garages to Grow Skills
thread.title_full: Kenya: Ge Launches Garages to Grow Skills

title: Kenya: Ge Launches Garages to Grow Skills
text:
Kenya: The Beast Arrives At JKIA Ahead of Obama Landing 
"We are delighted to collaborate with like-minded establishments on an initiative that aims to make more Kenyan youth employable in a fast changing technology-driven world. I'm looking forward to seeing great ideas that come to the GE Garage being transformed into practical business models that ultimately create more jobs in Kenya," GE Africa president, Jay Ireland said. 
GE launched the 'Garages' programme in March 2012 to stir interest in invention, innovation and manufacturing in America. The initiative went global with a workshop held in Lagos, Nigeria in 2014 and has since grown to include several countries in Europe and the Middle East. 
CLASSES AND WORKSHOPS 
To be hosted at Gearbox's premises in Nairobi, GE Garages programme will support classes and workshops for students and entrepreneurs to learn more about advanced manufacturing processes, software programming and business development. 
The programme will feature advanced manufacturing innovations such as 3D printers, laser cutters, computer numerical control mills industrial development to encourage entrepreneurial disruption and a skilled workforce for the future. 
"The provision of a GE Garage at Gearbox is essential to developing a continuous pipeline of people skilled in modern technologies and prepared to deliver tech solutions through business, who will serve as the "army" that will enable industrialisation on the scale that is required for our national development," Gearbox's chief executive officer, Dr Kamau Gachigi, said. Kenya
